alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 20 at 5:47AM EST until February 20 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... West Virginia... Ohio River At Belleville Lock affecting Meigs, Wood and Jackson Counties. For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River At Belleville Lock. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Ohio State Route 124 is flooded north of Stiversville Road, at Rock Run, at Wells Run to Smith Ridge to Dewitts Run, at Forked Run, at Curtis Hollow Road and between Long Bottom and Shade River. Ohio State Route 124 near the Washington and Meigs County line is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EST Sunday the stage was 36.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM EST Sunday was 36.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below its 35-foot flood stage later this afternoon or early this evening, and continue falling to below its 33-foot action stage overnight tonight. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 36.5 feet on 02/09/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 5 PM EST.
